description.narrative: Increased national capacity and strenghtened political commitment and accountability to implement national WASH policies, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Water, Sanitation and Hygiene

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Increased national capacity and strenghtened political commitment and accountability to implement national WASH policies

description.narrative:
During 2019 an important part of UNICEF support to the government was directed to actions that contributed to reinforcing the WASH sector coordination and monitoring role of the General Directorate of Water Resources (DGRH) at the Ministry of Energy Natural Resources.
The continuous work on digitalization of borehole technical information was shared with partners and drilling companies. The aim is to put the DGRH at the heart of sector crucial issues as it has been for sanitation with the government performing the monitoring and the verification of ODF communities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of monthly meetings held by the National WASH coordination mechanism (GAS) during the year
Water and sanitation policy validated. Norms and standards for wash in schools, urban settings and rural settings drafted, finalized and rolled out.
National monitoring systems reporting on equity of access to WASH services available

baseline.value: No national monitoring system in place
